content.webTitle: Brazil all alone in race for 2014 World Cup

fields.headline: Brazil set to host 2014 World Cup
fields.bodyText: Brazil, the five-times record winners of the trophy, is in line to stage the 2014 World Cup finals after becoming the only remaining candidate following Colombia's withdrawal from the bidding. The Brazilians submitted bidding agreement forms yesterday, ahead of Monday's deadline, while Fifa confirmed that the Colombian Football Association had pulled out on Wednesday. No reasons were given for the decision. Despite this seeming a one-horse race Brazil, which hosted the event in 1950, must meet technical requirements, provide government guarantees and complete its bid by the end of July. Fifa will visit the country in September and submit a report by November 1. Fifa's executive committee is expected to name the hosts later in November. Diego Maradona was readmitted to hospital, and reportedly taken into intensive care, in Buenos Aires yesterday, only two days after being discharged following two weeks of treatment for over-indulgence in smoking, drinking and eating. The former Argentina captain had been expected to travel to La Prairie clinic in Switzerland to continue his treatment, according to his personal doctor, Alfredo Cahe. But the 46-year-old was taken by ambulance to Los Arcos' clinic in the Argentinian capital yesterday after suffering severe abdominal pains.
